mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 13:37): I can't see the default xwiki language param in the admin panel. Any Idea?

mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 13:40): but in the same version of xwiki enterprise @ work it isn't  
mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 13:43): XWiki Enterprise 1.8.1.18545   
mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 13:43): oops - isn't that an old version?  
mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 13:47): i think there went something wrong with the import  
mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 14:01): Ok heres the szenario:  
mondstrahl128 - (10/06/2009 14:01): I worked with the 1.8.1 enterprise edition with jetty and hsql. Now i'd like to update to 1.8.4. How do i do that with the war file or via import / export ?

tachirei - (10/06/2009 15:17): florinciu: regarding XOFFICE-120 should I make a difference between LocalToWeb and WebToLocal filters? or just one IContentFilter interface and then classes that implement this interface?  
florinciu - (10/06/2009 15:18): I'm not sure. I see no difference right now.  
tachirei - (10/06/2009 15:20): OK. so only one interface IContentFilter  
tachirei - (10/06/2009 15:23): with 2 interfaces ILocalToWebContentFilter and IWebToLocalContentFilter it would be easier to apply filters; if by mistake we would apply a wrong filter we'll get a compile error.  
florinciu - (10/06/2009 15:26): yes, but what if you'll have a filter that need to be applied both ways?  
florinciu - (10/06/2009 15:27): and what are the chances of writing a wrong type?  
florinciu - (10/06/2009 15:28): you should have failing test anyway in such a case  
tachirei - (10/06/2009 15:28): hmm... you're probably right.. even I don't know an example like this.. I mean that's why we have now LocalToWeb and WebToLocal classes..   
florinciu - (10/06/2009 15:28): (tests)  
tachirei - (10/06/2009 15:28): anyway one interface should be ok for now

fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 16:45): vnkatesh: I've committed some changes to the UI plugin in order to remove .jars from the SVN (like Sergiu suggested)  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 16:45): vnkatesh: now you can use maven to copy dependencies  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 16:45): vnkatesh: just edit the copy-dependencies-pom.xml and run the copy-dependencies.sh script and it will create a lib directory with all the dependencies you need  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 16:46): vnkatesh: I mean, now you don't have to edit the xml, just run the script. but in the case you will need more dependencies you will have to edit copy-dependencies-pom.xml  
vnkatesh left at 16:47 ("http://www.mibbit.com ajax IRC Client")  
vnkatesh joined #xwiki at 16:53  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:01): fmancinelli: Hi  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:02): fmancinelli there?  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:02): vnkatesh: yep  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:02): fmancinelli in the cnf, selecting a page itself refreshes the browser.  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:02): fmancinelli how do I control that?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:02): fmancinelli I found that  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:03): fmancinelli CommonNavigator implements a selectionChanged listener.  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:03): fmancinelli But that is not getting me anywhere.  
jvelociter left at 17:03 ()  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:04): vnkatesh: public void selectionChanged(IWorkbenchPart part, ISelection selection) in org.xwiki.eclipse.ui.views.PagePreview  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:04): vnkatesh: this is the listener that is called when there is a selection change in the Workbench  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:05): vnkatesh: not only in the CN  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:05): vnkatesh: the listener is registered in the init method of the same class by using: getSite().getWorkbenchWindow().getSelectionService().addPostSelectionListener(this);  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:06): vnkatesh: does this answer your question?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:09): ok, thanks, I overlooke that, I guess  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:09): fmancinelli ok and, another thing, about "copy dependencies"?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:09): fmancinelli yes, it does. :)  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:10): vnkatesh: tell me  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:14): fmancinelli about "copy dependencies" that you said about in the mail?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:14): fmancinelli yes, so is there any alternate way by using pom to configure dependencies?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:14): fmancinelli instead of including it in lib/\*  
fmancinelli - (10/06/2009 17:15): vnkatesh: not sure of having understood the question. what would you like to do?  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:17): fmancinelli: ok, today sergiu had sent a mail, regarding putting all jar files in sources  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:18): fmancinelli: and you had replied that there was some method,  exisiting.. to "copy dependencies" before starting coding.  
vnkatesh - (10/06/2009 17:18): fmancinelli: so I was asking about that.

arunreddy\_ - (10/06/2009 18:58): sdumitriu : One more issue. Is it possible to make use of existing css page. And use it for a set of pages using skin extensions.   
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 18:58): ?  
arunreddy\_ - (10/06/2009 18:58): how are the  StyleSheets and Js pages handled in XWiki  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 18:58): What css page?  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 18:59): It's a page like any other pag  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 18:59): e  
arunreddy\_ - (10/06/2009 19:00): In MediaWiki A stylesheet or a js page is like normal wiki page. and its included ( embedded ) in the page and directly used. Is it the same with XWiki.  
arunreddy\_ - (10/06/2009 19:02): Thanks  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 19:02): That's not nice  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 19:02): You should make those JSX or SSX objects  
sdumitriu - (10/06/2009 19:02): And use them with $xwiki.jsx.use('Some.Script')  
arunreddy\_ - (10/06/2009 19:03): Ok. Its clear now.
